    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      myJTree()
      Whenever a myJTree object is instantiated, this instruction will be proved and it will read from tree.txt file and parse the tree accordingly and display the tree on the screen

    • Constructor Detail

      • myJTree

        public myJTree()
        Whenever a myJTree object is instantiated, this instruction will be proved and it will read from tree.txt file and parse the tree accordingly and display the tree on the screen

    • Method Detail

      • parseFileString

        public void parseFileString​(java.lang.String filename)
        This function will read the file line by line and create a tree accordingly
        Parameters:
        filename - A name of a file which is going to be read

      • createTree

        public void createTree​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String[]> NodeList)
        This function will check if node has duplicates and accordingly build a tree.
        Parameters:
        NodeList - An ArrayList that contains String Arrays

      • findNode

        public int findNode​(javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode root,
                    java.lang.String node)
        This function determines that if a node has a duplicate or not, and finds the node
        Parameters:
        root - A root of the tree
        node - string content of the root
        Returns:
        Returns 1 if root has a duplicate false otherwise returns the input

      • updateTree

        public void updateTree()
        Whenever the tree is edited, this method will be provoked and update the Tree

      • BFSAlgorithm

        public javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode BFSAlgorithm​(java.lang.String nodeSearched)
        A searching algorithm that performs BFS search to find node
        Parameters:
        nodeSearched - A node that is going to be found

      • DFSAlgorithm

        public javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode DFSAlgorithm​(java.lang.String searchedNode)
        This code makes a Depth first search to find the tree
        Parameters:
        A - string node content that is going to be searched in Tree
        Returns:
        If node is found it will return a DefaultMutableTreeNode, null otherwise.

      • searchNodePath

        public java.util.ArrayList<javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode> searchNodePath​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> source)
        This method finds the path of the given String and parse it into an ArrayList node by node
        Parameters:
        source - A string path that is going to be parsed

      • moveToPath

        public void moveToPath​(java.util.ArrayList<javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode> path,
                       java.lang.String destination)
        This function checks the error conditions such as whether path exist or not, whether node exist or not, if is there a duplicate node in given etc. It will move the node to destination point if error conditions does not occur.
        Parameters:
        path - A list that stores the nodes which leads to desired path
        destination - A destination point for a node in the path

      • moveNode

        public void moveNode​(java.lang.String moveFrom,
                     java.lang.String moveTo)
        This method finds the node in the given path and moves it to path "moveTo"
        Parameters:
        moveFrom - A node path that is going to be searhed
        moveTo - A destination node for the found node

      • expandAllRows

        public void expandAllRows​(javax.swing.JTree tree)
        This method will expand all the nodes to see the leaf nodes clearly
        Parameters:
        tree - A JTree object
